summary: Ethereum price may reach $2,500 due to ETH 2.0 staking deposits. However, it's important to note that the content provided on the website is for educational and research purposes only and should not be taken as investment advice. Always do your own research and consult with a financial advisor before making any investment decisions.

title: Lisk blockchain will become an Ethereum Layer 2 via Optimism and Gelato - The Block
summary: Lisk, a blockchain launched in 2016, is transitioning to become an Ethereum Layer 2 solution through a partnership with Optimism and Gelato. The new Lisk network will be powered by OP Stack and built using Gelato's rollup-as-a-service platform. The move aims to provide cheaper fees and improve usability across various DeFi protocols in the Ethereum ecosystem. The Lisk team will also migrate the LSK token to Ethereum and continue reward-sharing mechanisms. The collaboration with Gelato allows Lisk to deploy the OP chain quickly without writing additional code, and the partnership with Optimism underscores the importance of Layer 2 solutions for scaling the blockchain movement.

title: Ethereum: Here's How to Be a Millionaire When ETH Hits $3000 - Watcher Guru
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has surged 87% since the start of 2023, but its growth is overshadowed by other cryptos like Solana (SOL) and Bitcoin (BTC). Despite this, analysts expect ETH to rally to new highs in the next bull run. To become a millionaire when ETH hits $3000, an investor would need around 333 ETH tokens, which would be worth around $747,000 at current prices. Some predict that ETH could reach its all-time high of $4878 by 2025, making some holders millionaires.

title: Solana shows renewed strength against Ethereum in SOL/ETH ratio - CryptoSlate
summary: Solana (SOL) has shown renewed strength against Ethereum (ETH) in the SOL/ETH ratio, according to CryptoSlate. title: Ethereum proof-of-work core development team disbands - Cointelegraph
summary: The Ethereum proof-of-work (PoW) core development team has disbanded, with the EthereumPoW blockchain set to continue running on PoW as the main consensus mechanism. The team's decision comes after the successful hard fork of the Ethereum mainnet in September 2022, which transitioned the network from PoW to a proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism. Some developers were dissatisfied with the increased centralization of the new PoS consensus and created EthereumPoW to preserve the original Ethereum. However, the EthereumPoW tokens (ETHW) have yet to develop meaningful liquidity, and the team's decision to disband may impact the token's future.

title: SEC Viewing Ethereum as a Commodity? Bloomberg Analyst Sees ETF Shift Happening - CCN.com
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

The SEC is treating Ethereum as a commodity, according to Bloomberg analyst James Seyffart, which could lead to the approval of spot Ethereum ETFs in 2024. The SEC has not objected to ETH futures, which suggests acceptance of Ethereum as a commodity. This is despite SEC Chairman Gary Gensler's argument that most cryptocurrencies are securities. The approval of Ethereum ETFs would follow the approval of Bitcoin ETFs and suggest a shift in the SEC's regulatory approach to cryptocurrencies.

title: Ethereum Price Forecast – Ethereum Continues to Consolidate - FX Empire
summary: Ethereum price forecast: consolidation continues. No clear trend in sight. 📉💰 #Ethereum #Cryptocurrency #FXEmpire

title: SEC delays several Ethereum ETFs, pushing final decision to May - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

SEC delays decision on several Ethereum ETFs, including Hashdex and Grayscale, until May 2024. This is not unexpected, as the SEC has yet to approve a spot or mixed-type Ethereum ETF. The agency has approved Ethereum futures ETFs in the past, but is taking a more cautious approach with spot ETFs. The delay is seen as standard procedure and does not change the overall positive outlook for Ethereum. Meanwhile, the SEC is expected to decide on 13 spot Bitcoin ETFs by Jan. 10, 2024, with a 90% chance of approval.

title: Ethereum Restaking Protocol EigenLayer Surpasses $900M in Deposits - Yahoo Finance
summary: EigenLayer, an Ethereum restaking protocol, has surpassed $900M in deposits, a nearly fourfold increase in just a few days. The protocol's TVL has climbed from $250M to $900M following adjustments to deposit caps for liquid staking assets. EigenLayer enables users to deposit and re-stake ether from various liquid staking tokens to secure third-party networks. The increase in deposit caps and the wider range of LSTs have fueled a surge in activity, with many users depositing funds to participate in the network and earn points.

title: Ethereum Price Poised for Blastoff? 10% Breakout in Sight, But ETH Uptrend Faces a Crucial Test - CoinGape
summary: Ethereum price is poised for a potential blastoff, with a 10% breakout in sight. The token has been consolidating after a rejection from a new high in 2023, creating a falling wedge pattern on the four-hour chart. If the token can rise above the upper trendline of the wedge, it could break out and target highs above $3,000. However, support at $2,230 must be maintained to confirm the breakout. The Money Flow Index (MFI) is trending north, indicating more bullish pressure than selling pressure. If the support at $2,230 weakens, traders may decide to close their positions and wait to buy again when the token taps a solid support.

title: Bitcoin & Ethereum Price Prediction: Analyst Lays Out Bullish Targets & Timelines - Coinpedia Fintech News

Rover's prediction is based on increasing buying momentum for Bitcoin and advancements in Ethereum's ecosystem. However, the future is uncertain due to regulatory developments and macroeconomic trends.

title: Billionaire Mike Novogratz Says Bitcoin and Ethereum Could Pull Off Parabolic Moves if This Happens - The Daily Hodl
summary: Billionaire Mike Novogratz predicts parabolic moves for Bitcoin and Ethereum if institutions start investing in digital assets. He believes that the US government's inability to balance the budget and avoid deficits will lead to higher inflation and lower interest rates, making crypto more attractive to investors. Novogratz notes that even a small allocation of capital from institutions could lead to a supply crunch and drive up prices. He estimates that Bitcoin could reach $69,000 and potentially beyond that, and Ethereum could also see significant gains. However, he emphasizes that investing in crypto is high-risk and investors should do their due diligence before making any decisions.

title: Ethereum Price Restarts Increase But Can Bulls Turn It Into Rally? - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum price is recovering from a recent drop, with a 3% increase in value. title: SEC defers decision on several ETH ETFs to May 2024 - crypto.news
summary: The SEC has delayed its decision on several Ethereum-based exchange-traded funds (ETFs) until May 2024. The affected ETFs include the Hashdex Nasdaq Ethereum ETF, the Grayscale Ethereum Futures ETF, the VanEck spot Ethereum ETF, and a spot Ethereum ETF proposed by Cathie Wood’s ARK Invest and 21Shares. The SEC has cited a need for additional public input and thorough scrutiny before making a final decision. This delay comes after the SEC postponed its decision on Grayscale's application for a spot Ethereum ETF earlier in December. The ongoing delays have led to concerns in the market about hindered market development and limited investor access to diversified investment opportunities. However, the SEC maintains its commitment to protecting investor interests through thorough evaluation.

title: Ethereum Price Prediction as SEC Delays Hashdex and Grayscale Ethereum-Based ETFs – What's Going On? - Cryptonews
summary: The price of Ether (ETH) has rebounded from Monday's lows and is currently trading in the $2,200s, up over 4.5% in the past 24 hours. The bounce comes despite the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) delaying decisions on several Ether Exchange Traded Fund (ETF) applications, including ones from Hashdex and Grayscale. The SEC cited a need for more time to gather public input on whether the ETFs should be listed. The delay is seen as a temporary setback, as the SEC has approved Ether futures ETFs in the past and near-term approvals are likely. The crypto market is also being driven by macro traders betting on interest rate cuts in the US and around the world next year, which is lifting US equity prices and weighing on yields and the US dollar. title: Ethereum L2 Protocol Blast Sets New TVL Record above $900M - Coinspeaker
summary: Blast Network, a Layer 2 (L2) scaling solution, has set a new record for Total Value Locked (TVL) above $900 million. This achievement highlights the growing importance and adoption of L2 technologies, which aim to enhance the scalability and efficiency of blockchain networks. Blast's TVL surge is attributed to its scalability advantage, security, and interoperability, as well as the increasing demand for solutions that can accommodate higher transaction volumes without compromising decentralization and security. The L2 firm is on course for its mainnet launch scheduled for February 2024 and has intensified its search for senior engineers to support its growth. Early access members can expect to earn a 4% yield and make withdrawals as early as May 24 next year.

title: Ethereum Bearish Falling Wedge Pattern Appears, How Low Can Price Go? - NewsBTC
summary: Ethereum's price is potentially facing a significant decline, according to crypto analyst Alan Santana, as a bearish falling wedge pattern has appeared on the chart. The pattern suggests that the price could fall by up to 20%, with potential targets of $1,800 and $1,600. The analysis is based on the ETH's Moving Average Convergence/Divergence (MACD) and Relative Strength Index (RSI) indicators, which are showing a decline in momentum. The price is currently trading around $2,200, and a breakdown from this level could confirm the bearish formation. It is important to note that investing carries risks, and readers should conduct their own research before making any investment decisions.

title: Lisk (LSK) Plots Move to Ethereum as Layer-2: Details - U.Today
summary: Lisk (LSK), a DPOS protocol, plans to migrate to Ethereum as a layer-2 scaling solution to advance its key value protocol and provide a decentralized physical infrastructure network (DePIN) on-chain. The move is expected to optimize Lisk's plans to bring real-world assets (RWA) to emerging markets. The transition is made possible through collaboration with Optimism (OP) and Gelato Network, and Lisk will contribute to the development of the Optimism Superchain. The move has pushed Lisk's price to a new daily high, with the digital currency reaching $1.13 and its market capitalization reaching $145,573,784.

title: Value of Stablecoins on Ethereum Sees 34% Decline, Tron Records 57.7% Growth since 2022 - Cryptonews
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Stablecoin supply on Ethereum has decreased by 34% since 2022, while Tron has seen a 57.7% growth in stablecoin supply. Tether holds the largest market share at 56.3%, followed by USD Coin at 30.5%, and DAI at 5.07%. DeFi protocols hold only 5.5% of stablecoins, down from 25% in January 2022. The majority of stablecoin holders on Ethereum hold less than $1,000 worth of stablecoins, while addresses holding over $100,000 worth of stablecoins contribute 87.6% to the total stablecoin holdings. Stablecoins have seen positive supply growth in recent months, potentially due to increased use in funding cryptocurrency purchases.

title: Did You Trade Ethereum NFTs in the Last Two Years? You Can Claim This Airdrop - Decrypt
summary: Did you trade Ethereum NFTs in the last two years? You can claim a free airdrop of FRAME tokens, a new cryptocurrency designed for NFT creators and collectors. The airdrop is part of Frame's effort to create an ecosystem that prioritizes creators and enforces creator royalties. Users who have transacted NFTs on Ethereum in the past two years can claim varying amounts of FRAME tokens based on their trading activity. The tokens will be used for governance on the Frame network and to control the Frame Creator Fund. The project has also secured an initial fundraise led by Electric Capital and has plans to distribute more tokens to users and community members in the future.

6. Institutional interest: Growing institutional interest, including the potential introduction of an Ethereum-related fund by BlackRock, could support Ethereum's valuation.

title: Ethereum ETF Decisions Postponed as SEC Extends Review - CoinGape
summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has delayed its decision on two Ethereum-focused exchange-traded funds (ETFs) due to legal and policy issues raised by the proposed rule change. The SEC has initiated proceedings for the approval of the ETFs but has not reached any definitive conclusions. This delay follows previous delays in the approval of other ETF applications, including the Invesco Galaxy spot Ethereum ETF, which was moved to next year instead of December 23. The SEC has also opened a comment period to assess whether Ethereum ETFs should be treated differently from spot Bitcoin ETFs. The crypto sector remains hopeful after SEC chairman Gary Gensler acknowledged that the agency is reviewing the filings.

title: Ethereum price could drop 5% despite ETH PoW’s move to evolve into a deity-less public chain - FXStreet
summary: Ethereum's core development team has dissolved as part of a strategic move to explore the potential for independent operation without the core team's support. This move represents a significant transition in the organizational structure and a bold move to enhance community participation and decentralized governance. Despite this development, the Ethereum price could drop 5% as momentum continues to fade, with the bears in the lead according to the Relative Strength Index (RSI), Awesome Oscillator (AO), and Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) indicators. If the price breaks below the $2,075 support level, it could confirm the continuation of the downtrend and potentially extend the fall to the $1,935 level. However, if sidelined investors come in, the price could push back into the ascending channel and potentially target the range high at $2,403. In a highly bullish case, the price could shatter past the channel and reach the $2,500 level, constituting a 15% climb above current levels.

title: Veteran Trader Says Ethereum Will Drop Over 75% To $650: 'Price Charts Are Not Sacred' - Benzinga
summary: Veteran trader Peter Brandt warns that Ethereum (ETH) is set to drop over 75% to $650, despite a rising wedge pattern in its price chart. He believes classical chart patterns are not reliable and cites high transaction fees as a reason for his bearish outlook. ETH is currently trading at $2,246, up 3.60% in the last 24 hours.

title: Peter Brandt Calls Ethereum A “Piece Of Junk,” Shorts It To $650 - Blockzeit
summary: Veteran trader Peter Brandt has expressed bearish sentiment towards Ethereum (ETH), calling it a "piece of junk" and shorting it to $650. He believes ETH will no longer be a listed asset in 10 years. Brandt's prediction comes after Reaper Financial Founder and CEO Patrick Riley also criticized Ethereum, stating that it's a "dying horse that's been limping along for a long time." Despite these negative comments, Ethereum is currently moving in tandem with Bitcoin on the upside, gaining 3.5% in the 24-hour frame to $2,242. However, ETH is still down 54% from its all-time high and has shown double-digit gains in the monthly and annual charts. The primary strengths of Ethereum include its solid support from the crypto community, flexibility in smart contracts and dApps, and ongoing efforts to improve its economy.
